greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular table read by rows: T (n, k) gives the number of primes p such that p^k divides n; table omits all zero values.
comment: If the prime signature of n (nonincreasing version) is viewed as a partition, row n gives the conjugate partition.
formula: Row n is identical to row A124859(n) of table A212171.
example: 24 = 2^3*3 is divisible by two prime numbers (2 and 3), one square of a prime (4 = 2^2), and one cube of a prime (8 = 2^3); therefore, row 24 of the table is {2,1,1}.
xref: Row lengths are A051903(n); row sums are A001222(n).
results.author: _Matthew Vandermast_, Apr 28 2014
